name: NewYorker
text: Both the protests following George Floyd’s death and the coronavirus pandemic are the result of long-building problems whose warning signs went unheeded by the Trump Administration. https://t.co/ZwHOtONgOo

name: NewYorker
text: “Epidemiologists have recommended that, in order to be safe, one should social-distance by six feet,” Angela Merkel said. “It only stands to reason that I will be even safer if I social-distance by 21 million feet.” https://t.co/UXSqJWBPKs

name: NewYorker
text: Before any plants were taller than three feet, and before any animal with a backbone had made it out of the water, the earth was dotted with two-story-tall, silo-like fungi. https://t.co/FgeSPkgpT0

name: NewYorker
text: Mark Zuckerberg once promised that Facebook would connect the world, but it has since been used to spread misinformation, to sway elections, and to foment ethnic violence. https://t.co/eFwwp7f7g6

name: NewYorker
text: As the coronavirus continues to cyclone across the world, we will begin to learn more about how to predict the severity of a patient’s illness, and how infectious they are to others. How will these insights change the way we manage patients and hospitals? https://t.co/xrVklLMBSK

name: NewYorker
text: Mental-health experts unpack the mortal danger of the President’s mind. https://t.co/sjxsnWdxc9

name: NewYorker
text: “My before-self, before the pandemic, valued her sense of cheerful nihilism,” @EmilyFlake writes. “The tense, watchful person that replaced her is so quick to anger, so quick to cry, so agitated, and so sad.” https://t.co/HF5Icl2yRY

name: NewYorker
text:
Plans being discussed by the theatres for the release of Christopher Nolan’s new film, "Tenet," in July, include an entry kiosk that can scan patrons for possible fever and a checkerboard seating arrangement.
https://t.co/fkdQY6cXlZ

name: NewYorker
text: Within their borders, Heather Glazzard’s FaceTime portraits show all the tools used to make them: a computer with 68-per-cent battery remaining, a rectangular application window, two faces on either end of an Internet connection. https://t.co/bXwvY5YQGg

name: NewYorker
text: Anne Brigman was an artist who helped shape American modernist, feminist, and landscape photographic traditions—and she was one of the first women to photograph herself in the nude. https://t.co/SfTuOk065t

name: NewYorker
text: There is no better time than quarantine to become absorbed in Hilary Mantel’s Tudor trilogy, @jiatolentino writes. https://t.co/1QNfPkkkcB

name: NewYorker
text: The coronavirus pandemic has brought the U.S. economy to a standstill and has frozen the financial underpinnings of corporate loans. Is a debt blowout on the horizon? https://t.co/5JWSEl9GXH

name: NewYorker
text: .@mashagessen writes about waiting for her 18-year-old daughter, who was arrested alongside 50 other young people at a protest on Thursday, outside of One Police Plaza. https://t.co/FuGkCmFpVk

name: NewYorker
text:
In an attempt to sustain his restaurants’ supply chains during the pandemic and beyond, the chef and restauranter Dan Barber has started a program called resourcED, a C.S.A. for the most discerning aesthete.
https://t.co/5l1OXtbG3U

name: NewYorker
text: .@phoebe_bridgers started playing guitar seriously around age 13, after her mom tried to get her to learn piano. “I fucking hated being forced to do something. Reading music felt like math homework,” she said. “Guitar was my rebellion.” https://t.co/IPGff4Kbje

name: NewYorker
text:
The New York Botanical Garden is closed to the public, but a team of horticulturists are triaging the tropical specimens that would die without their care.
https://t.co/WA5EI3JFXU

name: NewYorker
text: A new photo series by Lisa Sorgini captures families in their newly circumscribed lives, showing women and their children through the windows of their homes. https://t.co/GMst8xOt45

name: NewYorker
text: “Freedom fries” (previously “French fries”) are now named “fire & fury fries.” They only come in one size: yuge. https://t.co/VghMzUC4ks
